theorems.name: euler_lagrange
theorems.type_signature: ∀ (L : LagrangianSystem), extremal L.action → euler_lagrange_eq L
theorems.doc_string: The Euler-Lagrange equation for a Lagrangian system

theorems.name: hamilton_equations
theorems.type_signature: ∀ (H : HamiltonianSystem), hamilton_eq_motion H
theorems.doc_string: Hamilton's equations of motion

theorems.name: harmonic_oscillator_solution
theorems.type_signature: ∀ (ω : ℝ) (hω : 0 < ω), ∃ (A φ : ℝ), solution_is_sinusoidal ω A φ
theorems.doc_string: The solution to the simple harmonic oscillator is sinusoidal

theorems.name: noether_theorem
theorems.type_signature: ∀ (S : SymmetryGroup) (L : LagrangianSystem), continuous_symmetry S L → conserved_quantity S L
theorems.doc_string: Noether's theorem: continuous symmetries yield conserved quantities

theorems.name: lorentz_group_SL2C
theorems.type_signature: IsGroupHom (SL2C.toLorentz)
theorems.doc_string: The Lorentz group is homomorphic to SL(2,C)

theorems.name: four_momentum_on_mass_shell
theorems.type_signature: ∀ (p : FourMomentum) (m : ℝ), OnMassShell p m → p.energy ^ 2 - p.three_momentum_sq * c ^ 2 = (m * c ^ 2) ^ 2
theorems.doc_string: Mass-shell condition for a relativistic particle

theorems.name: four_momentum_invariant
theorems.type_signature: ∀ (p : FourMomentum) (Λ : LorentzGroup), (Λ • p).invariant_mass_energy = p.invariant_mass_energy
theorems.doc_string: The invariant mass-energy is Lorentz invariant

theorems.name: pauli_matrices_algebra
theorems.type_signature: σ_i * σ_j = δ_ij * I + i * ε_ijk * σ_k
theorems.doc_string: Pauli matrix algebra relations

theorems.name: lorentz_boost_composition
theorems.type_signature: ∀ (v₁ v₂ : ℝ) (hv₁ : |v₁| < c) (hv₂ : |v₂| < c), boost_velocity v₁ v₂ = (v₁ + v₂) / (1 + v₁ * v₂ / c ^ 2)
theorems.doc_string: Relativistic velocity addition (boost composition)

theorems.name: time_dilation
theorems.type_signature: ∀ (Δt₀ v : ℝ) (hv : |v| < c), dilated_time Δt₀ v = Δt₀ / Real.sqrt (1 - v ^ 2 / c ^ 2)
theorems.doc_string: Time dilation formula

theorems.name: length_contraction
theorems.type_signature: ∀ (L₀ v : ℝ) (hv : |v| < c), contracted_length L₀ v = L₀ * Real.sqrt (1 - v ^ 2 / c ^ 2)
theorems.doc_string: Length contraction formula

theorems.name: twin_paradox
theorems.type_signature: ∀ (journey : TwinJourney), proper_time_traveler journey < proper_time_stationary journey
theorems.doc_string: The twin paradox: the traveling twin ages less

theorems.name: maxwell_field_tensor
theorems.type_signature: ∀ (F : FieldStrengthTensor), maxwell_from_tensor F ↔ maxwell_equations F
theorems.doc_string: Maxwell's equations in tensor form

theorems.name: electromagnetic_potential
theorems.type_signature: ∀ (A : FourPotential), F_from_potential A = exterior_derivative A
theorems.doc_string: The field tensor as exterior derivative of the 4-potential

theorems.name: plane_wave_solution
theorems.type_signature: ∀ (k : WaveVector) (ω : ℝ), is_maxwell_solution (plane_wave k ω) → ω = c * |k|
theorems.doc_string: Plane wave dispersion relation from Maxwell's equations

theorems.name: gauge_invariance
theorems.type_signature: ∀ (A : FourPotential) (χ : ScalarField), F_from_potential (A + gauge_transform χ) = F_from_potential A
theorems.doc_string: Gauge invariance of the electromagnetic field tensor

theorems.name: harmonic_oscillator_qm
theorems.type_signature: ∀ (n : ℕ) (ω : ℝ) (hω : 0 < ω), energy_eigenvalue n ω = hbar * ω * (n + 1/2)
theorems.doc_string: Energy levels of the quantum harmonic oscillator

theorems.name: creation_annihilation_commutation
theorems.type_signature: commutator a a_dagger = 1
theorems.doc_string: Commutation relation for creation and annihilation operators

theorems.name: ideal_gas_law
theorems.type_signature: ∀ (gas : IdealGas), gas.pressure * gas.volume = gas.moles * R * gas.temperature
theorems.doc_string: Ideal gas law: PV = nRT

theorems.name: boltzmann_distribution
theorems.type_signature: ∀ (sys : CanonicalEnsemble) (E : ℝ), probability sys E = Real.exp (-E / (k_B * sys.temperature)) / partition_function sys
theorems.doc_string: Boltzmann distribution for canonical ensemble
